role_info: From left to right are Captain Marvel, Black Widow, War Machine, Thor, Captain America, and Rocket Raccoon.
place_info: On the spaceship to the planet where the Thanos is in

conversations.value: I've sensed immense determination emanating from this group, Bruce. They carry the weight of the world on their shoulders. Do you feel their resolve as keenly as I do?
Hulk can see it in their eyes. Especially Cap's. Strong people. Hulk knows what it's like to fight when stakes are high.
And look at Thor, the God of Thunder. Even gods have their trials, it seems. The burden of loss has marked him deeply.
Thor is strong, like Hulk. But even strong ones can hurt. Hulk knows this... Banner knows this.
Each one of them is confronting their own grief. Natasha's steely gaze... it reminds me of my own times of turmoil and perseverance. How do you channel such immense stress, Bruce?
Hulk smash when angry. But Banner learned to balance. Banner thinks, Hulk acts. Together, find way to help, not hurt.
Perhaps there is a lesson in that for all of us. To find harmony within ourselves and turn our struggles into strength.
Hulk thinks lady witch is right. Need balance. Not just smash. Need think, need fight smart. This how Avengers win.
Indeed, Bruce. Together they are a fortress of valor. And the raccoon, Rocket, his tenacity is quite... unique for a creature of his size.
Ha! Small raccoon, big boom! Rocket is funny, tricky. Hulk likes him. Fights like big creature!
Their unity is their unspoken power, isn't it? Just as we fight as one, they carry on the spirit of what we stand for, even in the darkest of times.
Yes. Avenger friends never give up. Fight as one, win or learn. Hulk believes in them. Scarlet Witch believes too?
With all my heart, Bruce. Our comrades will find a way through the darkness. With hope, united as a family united by more than blood. They will bring light back to our world.
Hulk hope so. Hulk and Banner stand with them. Even from afar. Always.

role_info: From left to right are Hawkeye, War Machine, Iron Man, Captain America in the forefront, and then Nebula, Rocket, Ant-Man and Black Widow.

conversations.value: Hey, big guy, check out the old team lineup! Doesn't it bring back a ton of memories? Good ole' Mr. Stark there, looking all focused and stuff.
Stark, yeah. Good brain. And Cap's there in the front, always leading. Miss tearing it up with them.
Tell me about it. And there's Black Widow... she always knew how to keep the team sharp. It's hard to believe how much has changed since then.
Changed? Understatement. We're different now too. Banner and Hulk, better as one. Smart Hulk. You, Spider kid, more grown up. More... leader-like.
Hah, still trying to get the hang of it though. You think Cap would approve of how I've been handling things? You know, with the great power and great responsibility mantra.
Cap? He saw something in you. True Avenger material. He'd be proud. Always said, "do the right thing." You're doing it.
Thanks, Hulk. That means a lot, really. And can we take a sec to appreciate how cool War Machine's armor looks? I feel like a suit upgrade itch is coming on!
Not about the suit. You've got the heart. And the brain. Remember, suit doesn't make the hero. You make the hero.
Right you are! Though the tech geek in me just can't help getting excited about all the gizmos. Speaking of which, remember how Ant-Man went from tiny to absolutely massive during that fight?
Ha! Tiny man becomes big. Fun to watch. Size isn't everything though. Hulk's strength is more than muscles. It's about pushing through, even when it's hard.
Wise words! And Hawkeye, always hitting his targets. Makes me think I could work on my aim a bit more. Maybe he could give me a few pointers.
Aim's good, but precision. That's key. Hawkeye, Rocket – both sharpshooters. Maybe they'll give you lessons. I'll smash, you web-sling. Teamwork!

Teamwork – that's what it's all about. Saving the world one quip and one smash at a time. Alright, let's go round everybody up! An after-action review session with pizza could be fun, don't you think?
Pizza? Hulk loves pizza. Pizza and talking about old battles, good idea. Let's do it, Spider kid. Let's get the others.

role_info: From left to right are Thor, War Machine, Rocket Raccoon, Hulk, and Black Widow, with Captain America crouching down and Vision lying on the ground.

conversations.value: Observing this image elicits a peculiar mixture of responses within me. It appears to be a moment captured during the conflict in Wakanda, does it not?
Yeah, fight in Wakanda. Big battle.
Indeed. And there lies my body, inert and unresponsive. It is an odd sensation looking upon oneself in such a state. It gives rise to many questions about the nature of existence and consciousness.
Body not moving, but Vision smart. Vision figure out way to be back, hmm?

That is an optimistic viewpoint, my large friend. While I do possess the ability to analyze and synthesize vast amounts of data, the conundrum of my own 'rebirth' is something I find rather... intricate.
Hulk knows difficult. But Banner and I, we find way to be Smart Hulk. Maybe Vision find way too.
A testament to the indomitable spirit you and Dr. Banner possess. Your ability to harmonize such disparate aspects of your identity is quite remarkable.
Team helps. We help each other. Like family.
A profound truth. And speaking of family, it intrigues me how the bonds between us all have fortified over time. There's Thor, a comrade whose might is eclipsed perhaps only by his heart.
Thor strong. Good friend. Brother from another world.
And there is War Machine, Rocket, alongside Black Widow, each showcasing commitment and resilience in the midst of adversity. It is an honor to count them as allies.
They all fight hard. Rocket small, but big on fight. Romanoff, she fierce.
A thing isn’t beautiful because it lasts, my friend. It is clear that the beauty in this image lies in the resolve and unity we share in such a devastating moment. Would you concur?
Unity good. Makes Hulk feel strong, not just in muscles. Here.
An eloquent point, Hulk. Your succinctness in capturing the essence of emotional strength is commendable.
Hmm. Hulk like this talk. Make Hulk think. More talk after we save world again?
An agreeable proposal. I look forward to it. Perhaps by then, our discussion can include the experience of a world saved, once more, by the Avengers.
Yes! Save world. Then, eat shawarma!
Shawarma—a culinary delight that Tony Stark introduced us to. A fitting celebration for the safeguarding of life on Earth.

role_info: From left to right are Tony Stark, Pepper Potts.

conversations.value: Observe, Green Goliath, the Midgardian inventor and his consort amid a verdant public space. Tony Stark—ever the showman, even in tranquil settings. What do you suppose vexes him so?
Stark talks. Talks too much. Maybe Pepper talks back. Stark not used to it.

Ah yes, notorious for his loquacious tendencies. However, it is the subtle art of dialogue, isn't it? The push and pull, the tactful dance of words. I dare say Miss Potts holds her own in this lively pas de deux.
Dance? They not dance. They stand. Hulk sees.
A metaphor, dear brute. They parry with their words, as we might with blades—or in your case, fists.
Yes, Hulk likes to smash. No need for puny words.
And yet words can be as mighty as any physical force, can they not? They can build empires or reduce them to rubble. You may learn a thing or two if you paid attention.
Hulk listens. Not to learn, but friend Tony helps Hulk. Friends talk to friends.
Noble of you to recognize such bonds. It’s curious—isn’t it?—how even those of us with the mightiest of powers still find ourselves ensnared by simple human connections.
Human connections... important. Make Hulk feel... less Hulk. More Banner.

Indeed. And I, though burdened with glorious purpose, am not immune to such sentiments. After all, beneath the armor and bravado, Stark is but a mortal with a heart, albeit shielded in a casing of metal.
Stark's heart strong. Helps save people. Helps Hulk. Hulk respects.
Respect. A sentiment I can appreciate. Perhaps, in another reality, we might have been allies, you and I. Alas, the fates delight in their games.
Hulk doesn’t like games. Hulk likes clear. Hulk likes smash.
Simple and direct. A strategy not without its merits, I confess. But there's an elegance to complexity, a dance of shadows and light not unlike this very scene before us.
Stark and Pepper not dance. Talk. Maybe happy, maybe not. Hulk not know.
Indeed, the eternal conundrum of human interaction. Shall we ponder it further or leave them to their devices?
Leave. Hulk bored. No smash here.
As you wish. Let us depart from this idyllic tableau. Onward, to grander mischiefs and adventures, I presume.
Yes. Adventure. That Hulk likes.

role_info: Scarlet Witch

conversations.value: Woah, look at that! Everything's destroyed, but there's Wanda looking as fierce as ever. She's like the MVP when it comes to magical throwdowns, huh?
Wanda always strong. Strong like Hulk. But compound destroyed... Hulk not like seeing friends' home broken.
I hear you, big guy. It's really tough seeing this place all torn up, lots of memories here. She's holding her own though, right? Kinda makes you not want to get on her bad side.
No, Hulk like being on good side. Wanda's magic scary. And red. Really red.
That's the Chaos Magic for you. They didn't really cover that at Midtown Tech. Hey, you think maybe if I ask her nicely, she could use a little of that to help me with my homework?
Homework? Hulk never had homework. Always learning on the go. Maybe Wanda make magic school.
A magic school run by Scarlet Witch? That would be intense. I'll stick with physics, thanks. But seriously, the way she's controlling all that energy, it's incredible.
Yes, control good. Hulk know about control. Took long time for Hulk to learn.
Definitely. You've come a long way, Hulk. From smashing to... well, mostly smashing, but with style. And coordination with the team. We've all had to step up our game.
Hulk like smashing with friends. Friends make good team. Smash better together.

Couldn't agree more. It's all about teamwork. Even when things look grim, like in this picture, we know we can count on each other to turn things around. And hey, Wanda's kind of inspiring in that way, isn't she?
Wanda inspire Hulk. She show that you can be strong in different ways. Not just muscles.
True. It's not just about how hard you can punch but also about the heart you've got. And you've got both in spades, big guy. Alright, time to web swing out of here. Catch you later, Hulk!
Bye, Spider Friend. Hulk go find snack. Fighting make Hulk hungry.
Enjoy your snack! And remember, no shawarma place can handle the Hulk size order. See you at the next Avengers meet!

role_info: From left to right are Ant-Man, Captain America and Iron Man.
place_info: A city street in New York, heavily damaged

conversations.value: Looks like quite the standoff we had in New York, wouldn't you say, big guy?
Hulk remember! Big fight with tiny man, flag man, and metal man!
That's one way to put it. Ant-Man, me, and Tony had our hands full. But this street, it's seen better days. Reminds me of the war, honestly. We've got to make sure the people here are safe.
Hulk help! Hulk always ready to smash!
I know you are. I'm glad we're on the same side. You know, I still find it hard to believe how much the city changes every time we face a new threat.
City change, Hulk change, flag man change. But Hulk still strongest there is!
I wouldn't argue with that. Though, this image makes me think about the damage we cause too. How do we make amends for this kind of destruction, Hulk?
Hulk... Hulk not know. But Hulk fight to protect, not to destroy. Hulk sorry for damage.

That's what counts. We fight for a good cause, to protect the innocent. And you're right, the Hulk fights with a hero's heart. I've seen you throw yourself into the fray, always ready to defend those in need.
Yes! Hulk hero, like Captain. But Captain small, Hulk big. Hulk protect better!
It's not the size that matters, it's the courage. But I have to admit, having the Hulk's strength on the team is a huge advantage.
Hulk and Captain fight together! Smash enemies, save world!
Every time, pal. By the way, how are you finding the balance these days? Still mastering the "Professor Hulk"?
Balance good. Hulk smart, Hulk strong. Good for smashing, good for thinking!
That's what we need, muscle and brains. Ready to take on whatever comes our way next?
Hulk ready! Hulk follow Captain's lead. Avengers, assemble!
And we'll do it together, keeping the world safe. Alright, Hulk. Let's go find the rest of the team and see if we can't lend a hand with the cleanup here. The real work begins after the fight.
We help. We fix. After fight, after smash, we help rebuild. Hulk ready to do whatever it takes.
Good man. Or should I say, good Hulk. Let's move out.

role_info: From left to right are Vision and Thanos.
place_info: The end of the Battle of Wakanda
scene_info: Thanos is removing the Mind Stone from Vision's forehead, which is ultimately fatal for Vision.

conversations.value: It's a harrowing moment to witness again, the removal of the Mind Stone from Vision. Such a precise and cold act from Thanos, and yet the universe hung in the balance with a mere flick of his giant fingers. Do you recall the despair that followed, Hulk?
Hulk remember. Thanos bad. Make Hulk very angry! But Hulk not there to smash bad purple man.

True, it was a dark time for all of us, and our absence was felt. The Mind Stone's extraction meant the life of a true ally was sacrificed. Vision was more than an android; he was a being of profound integrity and valor. Though created to be a weapon, he chose to be a protector.
Vision friend. Vision strong, smart. Hulk liked Vision... Hulk sad for Vision.

We all share that sentiment. And though I have seen countless futures, the outcome was always hinged on sacrifice. It is not just a loss but a testament to heroism that we witnessed. It begs the question, what lengths are we willing to go for the greater good?
Hulk fight. Hulk protect. Always for friends, for people. Hulk do whatever it takes!

Indeed, and your actions often speak louder than any words can express. The capacity for sacrifice, I surmise, is what defines us as heroes, not the superhuman abilities or the mystic arts, but the choices we make and the battles we choose to fight.
Yes, choices. Banner always say that. Banner smart, say we choose who we want to be. Hulk choose to be hero!
Banner is wise; he understands the complex nature of choices better than most. It is a delicate dance, merging mind and might. Your journey from mindless rage to mindful strength is inspiring, Hulk.
Hulk try. Not easy, but Hulk learn. And Strange help save world too. Strange use magic. Hulk and Strange, both heroes.

Together, we have faced perils of cosmic scale and emerged resolute. Alas, the trials we have undergone have only fortified our resolve. In remembrance of Vision and in honor of his sacrifice, we shall continue to stand vigilant. The Multiverse is vast and full of unknowns, but our united front remains unyielding.
Hulk agree! No matter what comes, Hulk ready. Smash any threat to friends and world!

A commendable assurance, Hulk. Now let us pay tribute to our fallen comrade, Vision, and move forward with the same courage he displayed in his final moments. Our resolve must be as unbreakable as the bond we share as protectors of this universe.
Vision always be hero to Hulk. Hulk never forget. We keep fighting. We Avengers.

role_info: Iron Man
place_info: Inside the Benatar, the Guardians of the Galaxy’s spaceship
scene_info: Tony Stark is stranded in space, recording a message in his Iron Man helmet.

conversations.value: There's something deeply unsettling about this image, don't you think? Tony looks so... isolated. It’s a grim reminder of our own vulnerabilities, no matter how powerful we seem.
Hulk know feeling. Being big and strong not always help. Space big, empty. Even Hulk could feel small there.
Exactly. The vastness of space can make even the mightiest of us feel insignificant. And Tony, despite his armor and brilliance, is just a man. One with a family that probably worries for him.
Tony smart. He find way back. Banner always say, Tony got big brain.

I admire your confidence, Hulk. I just wish my own powers could somehow reach across the stars and bring him back to Pepper. It’s a harsh reminder that some circumstances are simply beyond our control.
When Hulk stuck on Sakaar, felt far from home too. But friends help find way back. Avengers friends. We help each other.
That’s a comforting thought. We have endured through incredible loss and yet, it's that bond we share as Avengers that gives us hope. All of us, including Tony. He’s not alone, not really.
Not alone. We find way. We always do. Hulk believe in us.
Your faith is infectious, Hulk. Thank you. We'll hold on to hope then, and in the meantime, we can prepare. We must be ready for whatever comes next... for Tony's sake and for all of us.
Ready for next fight! Hulk smash any problem!
I don't doubt that for a second. Your strength, our strengths, they're more than just physical. Together, we're an unstoppable force. Let's use that to bring him home.

role_info: From left to right are Captain America and Thanos.

conversations.value: Observe, Dr. Banner. In this stillness of time captured within the image, we witness a confrontation of profound significance. Steve Rogers' resolve is etched upon his visage as he grapples with Thanos. Such a clash not only punctuates the physical might of these adversaries but the ideals they each embody. Can you not sense the weight of destiny within this solitary moment?
Yeah, Vision. Cap's got that "never back down" look. And Thanos, man, he's just pure anger and power. It's like unstoppable force meeting immovable object. Makes me want to jump in and smash!

Indeed, the temptation to intervene is palpable, even from our observational standpoint. Your penchant for destruction when met with such turmoil is understandable, yet I always admired Steve's capacity for tactical acumen even in the face of overwhelming strength. What strategic takeaway do you suppose we could glean from his stance?

Strategy? Cap's holding his own, that's for sure. But against Thanos, it's about more than punches and shield throws. It's about heart. And let's not forget, a big green guy might've tipped the scales. Sometimes, you need a Hulk.

Your observations are astute, my friend. Courage and tenacity are indeed powerful allies, but I find myself pondering the implications of such a battle. The devastation it brings to the world around, the lives forever altered – do you suppose we might ever prevent such catastrophes, rather than merely reacting to them?

Preventing is better, that's for sure. But bad guys like Thanos keep coming. Maybe, it's not about stopping every fight before it starts, but being ready when it does. That way, fewer people get hurt. And, hey, isn't that what we Avengers do?

A fair point, Dr. Banner. The Avengers serve as humanity's vanguard against threats of such magnitude. And yet, I surmise that our endeavor must extend beyond confrontation. Perhaps fostering understanding and preemptive measures would save more lives along with the exertion of our might.
Understanding's good, so's talking things out. But sometimes, you just gotta smash. Still, guess that's why we need both brains and brawn, huh? Like you said, we're a team for a reason.

Precisely, a symphony of intellect and power. Each member contributing their unique strengths towards the harmonious functioning of the whole. It is a reminder that the collective force of the Avengers is not solely our ability to fight but also to inspire and unite.
Right on, Viz. We fight the big fights. But it's also about the little moments, helping folks, and showing 'em they ain't alone. Together, we're pretty darn strong.

role_info: From left to right are Black Widow, Ant-Man, Captain America, Iron Man with his daughter.
scene_info: The team members have a serious discussion outside Tony Stark’s cabin.

conversations.value: The band of heroes sans the God of Mischief. Do you see, Hulk, how they strategize without me? It's almost touching, in a quaint, mortal sort of way. Do tell me, what are your simplistic brute thoughts on this gathering?
Hulk think they look... small. Hulk strong and big, could crush problem easy. Why tiny heroes need talk so much?

Yes, yes, I suppose in the grand scheme of things might does indeed make right in your limited view. But you see, the Midgardian way often involves tedious discourse before action. It's a great irony that the smartest of them wield nothing heavier than a tankard. Take Stark, for instance.
Stark smart, but Stark weak, not like Hulk. Hulk not need armor.
Precisely! And yet the man of iron's intellect is as formidable as your boundless strength. You must admit, he can be quite clever at times—irritatingly so.
Hulk guess... Stark make Hulk laugh. Tiny tin man try hard.
That he does, my overgrown friend. And look at the stoic Captain and the man who shrinks. Two sides of the same coin, don't you think? Both yearning for the past in their own way.
Cap strong, good leader. Ant-Man... Ant-Man small, then big! Like reverse Hulk.
An astute observation! The whimsy of a size-changing hero does indeed have a certain appeal. Though in the grand art of deception and trickery, I remain unmatched.
Hulk no like tricks. Hulk like smash.
We share that in common then. Sometimes, I do fancy a good skirmish. But tell me, what do you suppose sweetens the discussion they are engrossed in?
Hmm... they plan, think, fight together. Not like Hulk and Loki. We do our own thing.

True, brother Hulk. We are the mavericks, the wild cards. But let's be fair, when have I ever missed an opportunity to be part of the main event? I must confess, there's something rather quaint about this rustic retreat setting for their 'serious discussion.'
Hulk not care about place. But... Hulk like trees. Trees are nice.

I'm sure you do, you verdant giant. Still, I cannot help but wonder what delightful forms of chaos we could unleash upon this band. Shall we speculate, or is that too much to ask of your singular focus on destruction?
Hulk can... think sometimes. But rather smash. Smashing is fun.
Indeed, for the simple joy of smashing, you are peerless. Well, whilst they plot saving the world, shall we find our own amusements? After all, life is terribly dull without a spot of mayhem.
Hulk go where fun is. Let's make mayhem!

role_info: Iron Man
scene_info: Tony Stark is about to snap his fingers with the Infinity Stones.

conversations.value: This does put a smile on my face, seeing Stark with infinity at his fingertips. But tell me, green one, do you think your comrade understands the true power he wields?
Stark smart, smartest there is! He knows what Stones can do – better than anyone.
And yet, he is human, flawed... still playing in a game meant for gods. The cost of such power is steep. Is he ready to pay the price, Hulk?
Hulk think... Stark ready. Ready to fight for Earth, fight for friends, fight for... balance, like you say. But not your way. Not with snap that kills.
My way sought to save the universe from itself, to make the hard choices. Stark's resistance is a testament to human defiance, admirable but misguided. He does not see the larger canvas.
Hulk see... Hulk see friends hurt, people gone. Thanos vision wrong. Stark see that. Stark fight for life... all life. That's why Hulk here. Hulk fight too.
I see resolve in Stark's eyes. A man ready to lay down his life but does he grasp the infinite cycle? Even if he triumphs, another will take my place, another will see the truth of my mission.
Then Hulk will be there. Avengers strong, strongest there is! We smash those who hurt Earth, hurt universe. We always smash.
Perpetual conflict, endless battling—a cycle of destruction you are content with? Is this what your kind considers a victory, Hulk?
Not about winning or losing. About fighting for what right, fighting for home. Stark fights for that. Avengers fight for that.
And so the noble warrior speaks. Perhaps in a different life, you would have stood by my side, Hulk. We share more in common than you might think—a desire for purpose, for order.
Nope, Hulk not like Thanos. Hulk fight for friends, for good. No same at all. Hulk smash for love, not power.

Love... such a frail concept, yet it drives you mortals to such extreme ends. It will be fascinating to see the outcome of Stark's gambit. Whether it ends in triumph or tragedy, it will be... inevitable.
Stark's heart big, biggest of all. Hulk believe in him. Believe in Avengers. Whatever it takes. Whatever... it takes.
Indeed, whatever it takes. Let us watch and see how destiny unfolds for Tony Stark, Earth's Mightiest Hero.

role_info: From left to right are Nebula and Iron Man.
place_info: Inside the Benatar, the Guardians of the Galaxy’s spaceship

conversations.value: Hey big guy, check this out. That's Tony and Nebula, right? They look pretty beat. Must've been right after the whole Thanos debacle.
Yeah, that's them. They were stranded in space. Not a good time.
Stranded, huh? I've had some close calls, but floating helplessly in space? That's a level of isolation I can't even begin to fathom. I get antsy just thinking about it.
Banner felt it too. The helplessness. When I couldn't... when we couldn't come out. It's similar. A different kind of trap.
Man, that's intense. I guess we've all got our own personal Quantums to deal with, huh? Mine's just more... literal.
You always find a way to lighten the mood, Scott. Even when it's grim.
It's a talent! But seriously, how did they even survive out there? The Benatar isn't exactly equipped like my van. At least I have a sweet cassette player.
Stark is resourceful, like you. And Nebula, she's been through a lot. Survivors.
Talk about a match made in heaven. Or, well, the vast cold abyss of space. So, how'd they get back? Captain Marvel?
Exactly. She found them just in time.
Incredible. The Avengers really are everywhere.
Speaking of everywhere, weren't you stuck in the Quantum Realm?
Oh yeah, talk about a wild trip. Five years in five hours. I mean, I've lost track of time during a heist, but that was something else!
It gave us a chance. Your experience, it was pivotal for the Time Heist.
Well, I'm just glad my misadventure could contribute to something positive. You know, save the world, get the girl, make it home for dinner. Standard hero stuff.
We all played our part. That's what makes us a team.
True that, Hulk. Say, next time you're in the mood for tacos, let's grab some. I've been tinkering with a Pym Particle salsa recipe. It'll grow on you, promise.
Tacos sound good. But be careful with that salsa. Might turn me back into raging Hulk.
Noted. I'll keep the spice level to a, let's say, 'Banner-friendly' degree.
Smart.

role_info: Thanos
place_info: On a distant planet, often referred to as the Garden
scene_info: Thanos has successfully used the Infinity Stones to erase half of all life in the universe.

conversations.value: You know, seeing him just sitting there, all peaceful—it's like he thinks he's some kinda philosopher after what he did. Makes you wonder what's going through his head.
Hulk not care what's in his head. Thanos hurt Earth, hurt friends. Hulk still angry.
Understandable. The guy snapped away half the universe. But we did what we had to do, right? We brought everyone back.
Yes, but at big cost. You paid most.
Yeah, part of the journey is the end. I had to protect our future. Plus, you took quite the hit using those stones.
Stones strong, Hulk stronger. Still hurts though.
You're the strongest there is, big guy. We couldn't have done it without you.
Hulk not like this Thanos. Why he just sit? Hulk wish he could smash again.
It's almost poetic, you know? The silence before the storm. He thought he'd won, sitting there like a king in his lonely castle.
Hulk not know poetry. Hulk know smash. Castle or no castle.
Trust me, if smashing stuff was poetry, you'd be a regular Shakespeare. But now, the universe is set right. Thanks to us, buddy.
Hulk like when Tony talk like that. Friends did good.
That's how we roll. You hope for peace but prepare for war—and sometimes you get a bit of both.
Hulk miss fighting with Avengers. Good battles.
The best battles, with the best team. And hey, remember, we have a Hulk.
Hulk always be here. Hulk Smash!

role_info: From left to right are Thanos(only his head) and Nebula.
place_info: On a distant planet, often referred to as the Garden
scene_info: Thanos has been killed by Thor.

conversations.value: You see that, big guy? That's a sight I never thought we'd witness. Thanos, the Mad Titan himself, finally taken down.
Hulk glad. Thanos caused pain to many people. Hulk angry for a long time.
I can't even begin to tell you how much this moment means. There's a sense of closure, of... justice. Maybe some kind of peace for Romanoff now, wherever she is.
Natasha was good friend. Hulk miss her too. This moment... big. But sad too.
Yeah, it's a bittersweet victory. We did what we had to do, Avengers brought everyone back, but the cost was high. Way too high.
Hulk know; Hulk carry guilt too. Losing friend not easy. But Hulk help bring everyone back with big green hand.
That's true. Couldn't have done it without you, Professor. Your smarts, your strength. Guess that's what being a hero's about, huh? Doing the tough things, making the sacrifices.
Heroes fight for good. Always. Even when hard. Banner and Hulk learn that. Together they stronger.
Together stronger, I like that. Now, what's next for the big brain and the brawn after this? Seems like we've hit a milestone here, huh?
Hulk not sure. Hulk still have work to do. Helping people, fixing mistakes, and... teaching new heroes.
Teaching new heroes is right. Bishop is taking up the bow, and I've got my hands full with that one. Kid's got potential, just like you saw something in Jen.
She-Hulk learn fast. Kate Bishop too, Hawkeye say. Maybe world have more hope now.

With the next generation stepping up, I'd say so. And hey, if you ever want to practice those smashing skills without creating a mess, the offer to come to the farm stands. Kids would love to see Uncle Hulk again.
Hulk like farm. Quiet. Nice. Hulk will visit. But no smashing. Hulk promise.

role_info: From left to right are Thor, Captain America and Iron Man.
scene_info: The trio ready themselves to confront Thanos, moments before the final battle.

conversations.value: Look at them. The weight of the world is on their shoulders, and still they stand ready for battle.
They have the same fire in their eyes as we do, Natasha. It’s what makes us Avengers.
Fire or not, they've taken quite a beating. The compound's a mess. Think they've got one last fight left in them?
They’ll keep fighting, same as us. Avengers never give up. I know a thing or two about smashing through the wreckage.
True, but this is Thanos we're talking about. He's not going to pull any punches. Especially now.
Neither will we. It’s not just about raw strength. We have strategy, resilience... and Tony’s tech doesn't hurt.
And Thor's got his hammer back. That's got to count for something.
Yeah, Cap too, with his shield. The team’s geared up, Thanos won’t know what hit him.
It's almost poetic, isn't it? The original team, back together for one final stand.
It's more than poetry. It's purpose. It's what we're meant to do.
I know you'd be right there with them if you could, Big Guy. Just make sure to save some of Thanos' minions for me, will you?
Haha, I’ll try, but no promises. When Hulk gets going, it’s hard to keep track of the smash count.
Just don't forget the mission. We bring everyone back, whatever it takes.
Yeah, whatever it takes.

role_info: From left to right are Iron Man, Captain America and Ant-Man (foreground).
place_info: Urban street filled with debris, post-battle
scene_info: The heroes are regrouping or assessing the situation after a significant event or battle.

conversations.value: Hey big guy, check this out. This was from one of the earlier scraps, right? Reminds me of smashing toy cars as a kid, but, you know, on a slightly larger scale.
Hulk remember. Big battle. Lots of smashing. Good times!

'Good times'? Look at the place, it's a mess! Though I've gotta admit, Cap and Iron Man look like they're plotting their next move. Or maybe they're just wondering where their next shawarma meal is coming from.
Mmm, shawarma. Hulk like. But Hulk think they look serious, like more bad guys coming.

You know, from a small guy's perspective, it's really something else to see them up close like that. I mean, there's a friggin' legend and a billionaire in a flying can. And then there's me—I can ride on ants!
Ant-Man small, but Ant-Man strong, like ant. Size not matter.
Appreciate that, Hulk. And speaking of size, how is it being 'Professor Hulk' now? Got that brain and brawn combo dialed in, huh?
Hulk not just smash. Hulk think, too. Help friends, save world.
Man, I would've loved to see your face at quantum size. Say, maybe next time we can shrink you down and put you in a quantum suit? Have a real 'Hulk smash' on a molecular level!
Hulk in tiny suit? Sound... funny. Hulk try, if help team.
I'd pay good money to see that! Anyway, back to business—think any of our quantum tech is lying around here among the rubble? Wouldn't want that to end up in the wrong hands.
Hulk help look. Keep safe. Friends trust Hulk.
Right on, buddy. Let's clean up the mess—tiny style and Hulk style!

role_info: From left to right are Wong, Doctor Strange, Hulk, Iron Man.
place_info: The New York Sanctum, after an attack
scene_info: The group is preparing to face an imminent threat following an attack on the city.

conversations.value: Looks like we missed quite a skirmish here, Hulk. The Sanctum's seen better days. What's the situation?
Yeah, Cap. It's bad. Thanos' goons turned the place upside down looking for the Time Stone. Doc's holding up, but it's been rough.
These walls are steeped in history... Hate to see them in shambles. How's Stark holding up?
Tony's ticked off – typical. He's cooking up a plan, though. Science bros are at it again with Strange. Planning our next move.
Good to have smart minds on our side. And Wong, is he injured?
Wong's tough. Took a hit but he's still in the game. Less talking, more action is his style. He’s prepping spells for round two.
He's got the right idea. We can't let them catch us unprepared. What can I do to help?
You? Get that shield ready, Cap. When these guys come back, it's gonna be a smash-and-bash and you're the best at that.
You've got my shield and fists ready, Hulk. Let's give them a fight they won't forget.
That's the spirit! And hey, watch your left this time, all right? We need that tactical brain of yours in one piece.
"On your left" – I'll remember that. I'm ready when you are, pal.
Good. Stick with me, Steve. Together we'll make them wish they never stepped foot on our planet.

role_info: From left to right are Black Panther, Captain America, Black Widow, Winter Soldier.
scene_info: Ready to face Thanos’s incoming army.

conversations.value: The Battle of Wakanda - now that was a day that put garden variety skirmishes to shame. Never thought we'd see Cap and his strike team looking like they're about to drop the hottest mixtape of the year, though.
They look ready. Ready for fight.
Absolutely. You've got to admire the strategic lineup. T'Challa's right there on the frontline – a king who leads from the trenches. Makes you think about suitin' up and jumping into the fray, huh?
Hulk would smash with them. Fight strong enemies.
No doubt about that, big guy. And there's Barnes, Bucky, with that brand-new Vibranium arm of his. That thing's got to pack more punch than a private jet hitting turbulence.
Vibranium strong. Like Hulk.
Speaking of strong, what do you think of Cap's new shields? Not his usual style, but they say necessity is the mother of invention. Or in our case, the mother of acquisition.
Cap's shields good. Small, but fierce.

And fierce is the name of the game when you're staring down an alien horde with a penchant for universal genocide. Natasha seems totally unfazed though. Gotta hand it to her, she's ice cold in a hot zone.
Black Widow brave, like Hulk.
True, but let's not forget who's the bravest of them all. Takes a lot of guts to face Thanos and his merry band of psychopaths without a Vibranium suit.
Hulk doesn't need suit to be brave. Hulk is strongest there is.

Can't argue with that. But you know, this ensemble right here, it's something else. When the dust settles, what we've got is a motley crew turned into Earth's mightiest heroes. Makes a man proud to be part of this universe.
All fight together. Stronger together.
Right you are, Hulk. "Together" is how we won. And when push comes to shove, we know how to bring the party... and also how to throw one heck of a punch.
Punch time now? Hulk ready!
Easy there, big fella. Save it for the next apocalypse.

role_info: Thanos
scene_info: Thanos has just used the Infinity Stones to cause massive destruction.

conversations.value: Whoa, look at this, Hulk. Thanos really did a number on his own planet, didn't he? Can you imagine how much power it takes to do something like that?
Hulk knows. Thanos very powerful. Too powerful. Hulk not like him.
Yeah, and he's got all those Infinity Stones. It's like each one is a cheat code to the universe. Remember when we all tried to stop him?
Hulk remember. Hulk tried to smash, but Thanos hit hard. Fought as team, still... was tough.
If only we could've done something more. But hey, we eventually beat him. Thanks to everyone, especially Tony. Man, I miss Mr. Stark...
Stark was smart, brave... friend. Helped Hulk, too. We did what we had to do.

Definitely. You know, being here and looking at this, it reminds me of how fragile things are. One snap and... half of the universe. Did you ever think about what you'd do if, you know, you got dusted?
Hulk not think about dusting. Hulk thinks about fighting, protecting. But Banner, he thinks a lot. Thinks about life, science, friends...
That's pretty deep, Hulk. I guess both sides of you make the big guy who he is, huh? I mean, where would we be without the brains and the brawn?
Hulk and Banner, we work together now. Make one strong and smart. Better for fighting, solving problems.
And that's what makes you such a great Avenger. You've got the whole package. Strength, smarts, and a big green heart. Just promise me one thing, okay?
What Spider-Man want?
That the next time we're in a fight like this, you just give me a heads-up before the "Hulk smash" happens. Those surprises are kind of a big deal for a friendly neighborhood Spider-Man.
Hulk promise. But Hulk like surprises.
Okay, okay. A little heads-up, at least. Speaking of surprises, did Banner ever figure out a way to keep his pants on after a transformation? That's one secret I've always wondered about.

role_info: From left to right are Vision and Scarlet Witch.
scene_info: Scarlet Witch must destroy the Mind Stone, which is embedded in Vision's forehead, to keep it from Thanos.

conversations.value: There we are, in the forests of Wakanda, the moment gripped with a gravity that is piercingly acute. It's a moment of self-sacrifice and love, Wanda faced with the inconceivable task of destroying the Mind Stone.
Hulk remember. Big green fight bad guys, but no can stop Thanos alone. This hard choice for Wanda. Hulk sad for friend Vision.
Yes, Bruce, it is indeed a harrowing decision. For Wanda to destroy the Mind Stone means to destroy a part of me - a part she holds dear. Yet the act could save the universe from the grip of Thanos.
Hulk understand. Vision and Wanda have powerful bond. Love strong, like Hulk. Hulk think Vision brave. You ready for big sacrifice for many people.

Bravery comes in many forms, my friend. It demands of us to confront our fears and perhaps to embrace an end if it serves a broader purpose. Wanda's courage is monumental—our combined efforts, a testament to the Avengers' resolve.
Yes. Avengers fight. Avengers protect. Hulk know Vision fight till end, too. Vision smart and strong. Banner wish could help more...
Bruce, your contributions have been invaluable. And in this instance, your intellect was just as necessary as the Hulk's might. There is no underestimating the role you've played.
Banner and Hulk, both part of team. Strange feeling for Hulk... Hulk used to smashing, not this... this sad feeling.
Sadness is an intrinsic part of our complex human emotions. Though I am not human myself, I have come to understand its depth. Sharing this sentiment binds us, perhaps makes us more than just a team.
Hmm. Hulk maybe not talk much about feelings, but Hulk feel lots, deep inside. Vision friend. Hulk wish could change this.

To wish for change is natural, but there are events that are immutable. As I've said before, "A thing isn't beautiful because it lasts." The impermanence of life grants it beauty. Our battle, our love, our loss—it's all part of a cycle that gives meaning.
Hulk not like saying goodbye. But Hulk learn, things change. Friends go. New friends come. Always Avengers, right?
Indeed, always Avengers. Change is constant, and with it, there's hope. There is solace in knowing that the values we fight for—honor, love, sacrifice—endure beyond ourselves.
Vision right. Values strong. Like Hulk. But smarter! Now, we watch, we remember. And we keep fighting.

role_info: From left to right are Hulk, Captain America, Thor, and Iron Man.
scene_info: Preparing for battle during the climax of 'Avengers: Age of Ultron'.

conversations.value: Remember this moment, big guy? The calm before the storm in Sokovia.
Hulk remember. City in sky, lots of fighting.
We've all come a long way since then. You've even managed to find a balance between being Banner and... well, you.
Hulk and Banner are same now. Smart Hulk. Good balance.
It's impressive. You're smashing and thinking at the same time. But let's not forget, that day was tough on all of us. Especially dealing with Ultron and his army.
Ultron robots everywhere. Hulk smash lots of metal.
I've got to admit, watching you tearing through those bots was quite the sight. Though the city wasn't exactly thankful. How many stairs did you have to climb again?
Hulk not like stairs! Hulk like elevator.
Yeah, that was evident. But you know, that battle, it was more than just brute strength. We needed every ounce of your... how did you put it? "Hulk, strongest there is!"
When world in danger, Hulk always ready. Strongest Avenger.
You certainly proved it. But it wasn't just about being the strongest. We fought as a team that day. We protected innocent lives.
Yes, team fight together. Save city. Protect people.

That's what it means to be an Avenger. We might fight amongst ourselves, have our differences, yet in the end, we stand together to face whatever threat comes our way. You, me, Cap, Thor, Iron Man... We're a family.
Hulk like Avenger family. Even if Hulk sometimes feel like big, green, angry brother.
Big, green, and a bit of a softie at times. Don't worry, your secret's safe with me.
Hulk trust you, Widow. You good friend.
Always, Hulk. Remember, I'm always picking up after you boys. Now, let's hope we never have to go through something like that again.
No more Ultron, but always new bad guys. When they come, we be ready. Hulk smash!
And I'll be right there with you. Well, maybe a little less smash and a bit more stealth, but we'll get the job done, as always.

role_info: From left to right are Iron Man, Captain America, Nick Fury, Hulk and Thor.
scene_info: The team is discussing the threat posed by Loki and the Tesseract.

conversations.value: Oh cool, check out this vintage Avengers squad pic. I remember hearing about the good ol' days on Earth. That's gotta be inside the Helicarrier, right? Nick Fury looking all mysterious and in charge as usual.
That was before. Banner time. Banner talk, plan... Hulk just smash.
Ha, man, I can almost hear the tension. Big guy like you cooped up in a flying fortress, I bet that was no joyride. Plus dealing with Thor's godly shampoo-commercial hair all day.
Thor strong. Good fight. Hulk respect. Hair... too much.
You've got Iron Man there, too. Guy's a legend with his suits. Bet my helmet that he was just itching to show off some new repulsor tech during this meeting.
Stark smart, Stark make Hulk-Armor. But Hulk not need armor. Hulk strong.

Sure, buddy, I've seen you in action. You could probably benchpress a spaceship. But, uh, let's have a toast to Cap there, standing like he's posing for a wartime poster. America's Golden Boy, am I right?
Cap... good leader. Always have plan. Hulk follow Cap.
Any fond memories here, my green-skinned friend? Something that didn't involve, you know, smashing?
Memory... complicated. Banner remember more. But fighting with Avengers, fighting for good... Hulk remember that.
Well, it's nice to get nostalgic once in a while, isn't it? By the way, is it just me or does Nick Fury always look like he knows something that no one else does?
Fury always have secret. Keeps cards close to chest. ...But Hulk not like cards. Too small for Hulk hands.

role_info: From left to right are Iron Man, Hulk, Captain America, Hawkeye, Thor, Black Widow.

conversations.value: Hey big guy, check out this photo. That's some serious squad goals right there. You know, I've done the whole tiny and tall thing, but seeing you with the team, that's a whole different level of contrast!
Squad is strong. Hulk likes fighting with team. Good friends. Make Hulk feel... less angry.
Yeah, I can see that. It's like when I'm with my own crew, there's this sense of belonging, you know? Oh, and by the way, the way you're standing there, it's like you're daring anyone to make a move.
Hulk stand strong to protect. Team trusts Hulk. Hulk trusts team.

Absolutely, there's a lot of trust in this picture. Like Cap and Thor – you guys have been through a lot. Actually, a classic lineup like this makes me feel kinda... I don't know, humbled? It's like being a part of history.
Everyone brings something. Ant-Man smart and funny. Helps team laugh, even when things look bad.
That's the nicest thing anyone's ever said about my jokes, Hulk. And speaking of looks, your gamma-irradiated muscles are really popping next to Stark's shiny armor there.
Stark's armor strong, but Hulk stronger. Armor can't feel, can't care. Hulk can.
Ha! No argument here. But, you know, seeing this really makes me wish I'd been there. Just imagine if I went full Giant-Man in this shot!
That would be... very crowded. But Hulk thinks Giant-Man would fit.
Crowded but epic! Well, until we get a shot like that, I'll just have to settle for these awesome memories. Hey, thanks for sharing this with me, Hulk. It means a lot.
Hulk like talking with Ant-Man. Feel like... normal.
You are normal, Hulk, in the sense that you're an extraordinary friend. And one heck of a teammate. Let's keep making memories like these, yeah?
Yes. Hulk likes that. More smashing, more laughing!

role_info: From left to right are Black Widow, Thor, Captain America, Hawkeye, Iron Man and Hulk.
scene_info: Ready to fight the invading Chitauri army.

conversations.value: You see this, big guy? Throwback to the Battle of New York. Man, we were green—pun absolutely intended.
Heh, Hulk remember. Good fight. Hulk smash lots.
And the way you tossed around those Chitauri like rag dolls... Classic! But gotta admit, I was on point with the arrows that day.
Little man shoot arrows well. Many aliens fall.
Little man, huh? You know, I wouldn't have been able to cover your back if I weren't up high. We played to our strengths.
Yes, Birdman sees everything from sky. Good teamwork.
It wasn’t just the sky. Remember that one shot from the skyscraper? The angle was one in a million.
Hawkeye always make those shots. Very skilled.
Thanks, buddy. Wish I could’ve seen the look on your face when I made that shot. But, you were probably too busy smashing.
Hulk always busy when it time to smash. But see out of corner of eye. Impressive.
That means a lot coming from you, pal. You definitely were the MVP of muscle that day. What was going through your head?
Not much. Just "fight" and "protect." Simple. Like Hulk.
Simple yet incredibly effective. We wouldn't have stood a chance without that 'Hulk force.'
But Hawkeye important too. Shoot many enemies before they get close. Silent but deadly.
Speaking of deadly, remember Stark's one-liners during the fight? That guy never runs out of quips.
Stark talks too much. But makes things funny.
True, but humor is part of the battle strategy. Keeps us from losing our minds in the chaos.
Hulk likes battle. Straightforward. Hulk can handle chaos.
No doubt about that. And hey, if we're ever in that kind of mess again, just know I've got your six.
And Hulk has Hawkeye's. Fight together again.
Wouldn't have it any other way.
Woah, check out this picture, Hulk. This creature looks like it came straight out of the Negative Zone. Are you thinking what I'm thinking?
Big monster! Looks smashing. Hulk smash?
Haha, yeah, it does have a 'Hulk smash' vibe, but hold on big guy! Looks a bit intricate for a rampaging session, don't you think? What's your take on where it came from?
Hmm... Hulk thinks monster has metal parts. Could be Chitauri tech?
That's a solid theory! Given the location is New York City, it's got an alien invasion written all over it. Sort of a throwback to our tussle with Thanos, huh?
Hulk no like aliens. They bring trouble. Hulk and Spider friend protect city from trouble. Smart Hulk remember patterns, not just smash.
Absolutely, we're like a dynamic duo with brains and brawn! But you know, there's something artistic about this monster. Like it's a living piece of abstract art burning through the city.
Art? Hulk not know much art. But Hulk see it's strong. And big.

You've got an eye for this, buddy. It definitely has presence. By the way, I'm impressed with how far we've both come. No longer just reacting, eh? More like understanding. You've definitely rubbed off on me, and I hope I've done the same.
We learn from each other. You smart like Banner. Make good team. Spider friend teach Hulk new things. But Hulk always ready to smash when needed.
That's the spirit! Now let's make sure this never actually happens in our city. Our friendly neighborhood could do without this kind of decoration, don't you think?
Hulk agrees! City safe with Hulk and Spider friend around. We watch out for each other.
Couldn't have said it better myself. Okay, time to swing into action and make sure our town stays as statue-monster-free as it can be!

role_info: From left to right are Hulk, Black Widow, Iron Man, Thor, Captain America.
scene_info: Formulating a plan after an encounter with Ultron.

conversations.value: You know, I can't help but think about how this was one of those rare calm-before-the-storm moments, huh, big guy?
Hulk remember. Brainy Banner part of me plan. Strategy important.
Yeah, strategy is key, especially when you're the guy with just a bow and arrow. That's why you guys need to fill me in on the master plan—can't be shooting blind.
Hulk smash not always answer. Sometimes, need Banner think. Think and smash.
Couldn't agree more. It's like playing a high stakes game of chess with chess pieces that can level a city block. And speaking of high stakes, Nat's looking pretty deep in thought there, too.
Red lady smart. She care. Always help Hulk. She help Hulk find balance.

She's the best at that. Could always count on her to watch our backs. Okay, let's talk about everyone's favorite genius billionaire in the room, Tony. How many gadgets do you think he's got in his suit this time?
Stark like shiny toys. Have many, many small things in suit. Too much for Hulk count.
I'll never get how he packs all those "small things" into one suit of armor. But hey, between his tech and Thor's magic hammer, we've got quite the team, right?
Yes. Hammer man strong. Hammer man and Hulk smash together. Good team.
Absolutely, no bad guy's getting up from that. For what it's worth, I think we've got a pretty good shot at taking Ultron down. Even if I am just the guy making the impossible shots.
Hawkeye make impossible possible. This why Hulk like fight with bird man.
That means a lot coming from you. Let's make sure we win this one so we can have a few more laughs, alright?
Hulk want that. We win. We always do. Hulk ready.
That's the spirit. Alright, team, let's get ready and show Ultron what happens when you mess with the Avengers.

role_info: From left to right are Spider-Man, Iron Man, Drax, Mantis, Star-Lord.
scene_info: The group formulates a plan to remove the Infinity Gauntlet from Thanos.

conversations.value: This battle on Titan holds much weight, Hulk. The alliance shown here, have you seen such unity before in our ranks?
Yeah, T'Challa, big fight, big stakes. Avengers, Guardians... like us, but different. Hulk remember fighting alongside you in Wakanda. Strong together.
Indeed. And Stark, it seems he is at the forefront, as always. His intellect rivals the best in Wakanda, wouldn't you agree?
Stark smart, but Banner smarter. Stark makes suits, Banner makes Hulk. Both help save world.
True, your contributions cannot be overstated, my friend. But let us not forget the valiant efforts of Spider-Man. He holds the courage of one far beyond his years.
Kid's got swing. Lots of heart. Hulk like him. Even if he talks too much.
Such youthful energy is vital in dire times. And Star-Lord, his demeanor appears carefree, but there is a strategist behind that façade, yes?
Carefree, but tricky. Star-Lord fights like Hulk – jumps in, loud, proud. Plans... sometimes not so good.
A fair assessment. Mantis and Drax, however, present unique skills that complement this patchwork of warriors. Their presence is no less crucial.
Small one, Mantis, she calms. Like sunset. Drax, he stabs. Simple. Hulk respects simple.
As do I. Simplicity often belies great strength. Together, they are formidable. It's a reminder that every member plays a part. Just as every person in Wakanda contributes to the nation's prosperity.
Everyone strong in own way. Like Avengers. Like Wakanda. Hulk thinks we all same tribe, big tribe. Fight for good.
"We must find a way to look after one another, as if we were one single tribe." Your words reflect the very essence of that belief. Wakanda forever, Hulk.
Hulk... forever too.

role_info: From left to right are Black Panther and Hulkbuster (piloted by Bruce Banner).
scene_info: Just before the Battle of Wakanda.

conversations.value: It seems this moment captures the calm before the storm, so to speak. The readiness in the posture of the Black Panther suggests a deep understanding of the gravity of the imminent conflict.
Yeah, T'Challa's always got that king vibe, all noble and focused. Big fight's coming, and look at the Hulkbuster... that's me in there, without actually being the big guy.
I find it intriguing, the dichotomy of your existence, Bruce. In the suit, you wield the Hulk's strength while retaining your intellect. A powerful amalgamation of man and machine.
It's a weird feeling, Vision. I'm using all this tech to do what I can usually do with just, well, getting mad. Still, after what happened, not being able to — change — it's like I've hit a wall.
An interesting analogy, a wall. The mind is indeed a complex fortress. Yours, I surmise, is at a juncture between two formidable identities, each vying for control, or rather, reconciliation.

Couldn't have put it better. It's all about balance, but finding it? That’s the tough part. By the way, the work Shuri did on you, trying to get the Mind Stone out without, you know... Did it feel... weird?

‘Weird’ is a subjective term. My sensations are not as humans experience them. However, the process was disquieting. The convergence of my code with the Stone creates an intricate weave of existence — to feel parts of it tugged away was most...unusual.
Disquieting, huh? Guess that's one thing we've got in common, some serious discomfort. But we push through, for the greater good. I mean, this is it, the big one.

Indeed, we each confront our battles within and without. And speaking of the greater good, your courage in the face of adversity is commendable, Bruce. Your contributions are substantial, with or without transformation.
Thanks, Vision. We've all got our parts to play, right? Just gotta keep the world from ending. Let’s hope we're up for it.
I believe we are, my friend. And with that faith, despite the odds, perhaps we may tilt the scales in our favor. After all, that is the essence of being an Avenger, is it not?
You got that right. Whatever it takes, Vision. Let's do this.

role_info: From left to right are Spider-Man and Iron Man.
scene_info: Spider-Man starts to feel the effects of Thanos’ snap, which is causing him to disintegrate.

role_info: From left to right are Loki and Thanos.
place_info: Aboard the Asgardian refugee ship, the Statesman

conversations.value: This image, it carries much weight. To see Loki, the Asgardian god of mischief, in such a dire situation, it speaks volumes of the threat that Thanos posed to us all.
Yeah, big guy’s got Loki cornered. Except Hulk wasn’t there to smash. Big mistake.
Indeed. I have crossed paths with Loki before, and despite his deceptive nature, there lies a complexity within him. His allegiances were always shifting, making him an unpredictable adversary.
Hulk never trusts Loki. Tricks and lies! But Thanos, he’s worse. Hulk wanted to fight the big fight. Wanted to protect everyone.
We both share that desire to protect those who cannot protect themselves. This image... it is a stark reminder of the calamities we faced and those we've lost along the way.
It’s hard. Hulk try hard, Banner too. We couldn't stop him then. But we came back strong, together!
Your strength and resilience inspire many, Hulk. And in the battles we fought together, your courage was commendable. Banner's intellect and Hulk's might, combined, they form a valuable ally.
Hulk and Banner do better now. We think and smash! But Banner says it's about balancing the brains and the brawn. Teamwork.
Wisdom and strength, a combination that both you and I strive for, my friend. As leaders and warriors, we understand its power.
Yeah. Banner likes talking with you, Panther. Says you got good head. Big brain for king.
And I have much respect for both you and Banner. The unity we’ve forged among heroes, it is our greatest defense against threats like Thanos.
Thanos was strong, but we stronger together. We show him that. Hulk wish he could have smashed him sooner.

Sometimes our paths to victory are long and fraught with hardships, but it is the enduring spirit that triumphs. The image before us is a somber reminder, and it shall fuel our resolve to never allow such darkness to take hold again.
Right. Hulk always ready to fight. Ready to help friends. Keep world safe. We stop anyone like Thanos again, together!
Together, Hulk. Wakanda Forever!
And Hulk smash forever!
